title: Musk threatens to sue Apple over AI snub
description: Billionaire claims big tech giant favours ChatGPT over his rival app
content:
Elon Musk has threatened to sue Apple over claims the company is refusing to put his chatbot at the top of its iPhone download charts. The billionaire said xAI, which makes the Grok app, would take “immediate legal action” about what he alleged was an “unequivocal antitrust violation”. In particular, Mr Musk is upset that ChatGPT, made by rival tech company OpenAI, features at the top of the download store in the US and many other countries. He claimed that Apple had made it “impossible” for any other AI app to surpass it. In a post on X, he wrote:

He later wrote: “Hey @Apple App Store, why do you refuse to put either X or Grok in your “Must Have” section when X is the #1 news app in the world and Grok is #5 among all apps? Are you playing politics? What gives? Inquiring minds want to know.” Apple frequently features ChatGPT in sections of the App Store that recommend new apps, and the iPhone-maker has a deal with OpenAI to provide answers on its Siri platform. However, it is unclear whether the company makes it impossible for other apps to surpass it. Less than 24 hours ago, Mr Musk had celebrated Grok briefly jumping to the top of Apple’s download charts in Singapore. ChatGPT is also at the top of the rival Google Play Store’s download charts. Sam Altman, OpenAI’s chief executive, responded by saying that Mr Musk had used X, formerly known as Twitter, to benefit his own companies at the expense of his rivals. “This is a remarkable claim given what I have heard alleged that Elon does to manipulate X to benefit himself and his own companies and harm his competitors and people he doesn’t like,” Mr Altman wrote.

Since Mr Musk bought Twitter in 2022, the company’s algorithm has at times been tweaked to promote his posts. Mr Musk has frequently threatened legal action against OpenAI. He helped found the company but left after a dispute with Mr Altman over its non-profit status. Last year, he sued the company over claims he was manipulated into investing. OpenAI counter-sued, accusing him of “unlawful harassment”. A trial is due next year. He has previously threatened to ban Apple devices at his companies due to the deal between the iPhone-maker and OpenAI, and accused Apple of censorship after the company suspended advertising on X amid an antisemitism row. The Tesla chief has also criticised Apple’s App Store fees, which take up to 30pc of spending on apps, saying it is “like having a 30pc tax on the internet”. Apple is currently fighting an anti-monopoly lawsuit from the US government, as well as potential regulatory crackdowns in the EU and UK.
summary: Elon Musk has threatened to sue Apple over claims that the company is not promoting his chatbot, X, at the top of its iPhone download charts. He claims this constitutes an "unequivocal antitrust violation". This comes after X, formerly known as Twitter, became the world's top news app and was criticized by rival tech company OpenAI. Musk has previously threatened legal action against OpenAI, accusing them of manipulating X to benefit his own companies at the expense of his competitors. The company is currently under an anti-monopoly lawsuit from the US government and facing potential regulatory crackdowns in the EU and UK.
shortSummary: Elon Musk threatens legal action against Apple over its refusal to promote his chatbot, ChatGPT, in the App Store.
argos_summary: Elon Musk has threatened to sue Apple, alleging that the company is engaging in antitrust violations by refusing to promote his chatbot app, Grok, in the App Store. He claims that Apple is making it difficult for other AI apps to compete with ChatGPT, which is prominently featured. Musk's accusations come amid ongoing tensions with OpenAI, where he has previously threatened legal action and criticized Apple's App Store fees. OpenAI's CEO, Sam Altman, has countered Musk's claims, suggesting that Musk manipulates his platform to benefit his own interests.
